Kayako - ticket id 60223404 // ATLAS commented publicly: Dear Tyron,

Thank you for providing clear details and a screenshot regarding the intermittent 500 Internal Server Error messages encountered when using filters in your FogBugz On-Demand environment. Based on your description and the attached image, this issue is occurring for all users and only during filter operations.

According to our knowledge base article on FogBugz On-Demand performance issues [https://support.fogbugz.com/article/53690], this type of error generally indicates a temporary issue on the server side or a problem processing particular filter queries. Here are some steps and key diagnostic insights you may find useful:

1. Check for Known Outages or Maintenance
Before investigating further, visit the FogBugz Status Page [https://status.fogbugz.com] to make sure there are no ongoing incidents or maintenance activities that could impact filtering or server performance.

2. Immediate Steps to Try
- Clear your browser cache and cookies, then test filtering again.
- Try accessing the filters from another browser or device to rule out local browser-related issues.
- If your instance has a large volume of case attachments (e.g., many images or large files), filters may experience performance degradation. Open a filter with minimal results or create a new basic filter to see if the issue persists.

3. Issue Scope and Nature
Your screenshot and notes confirm that:
- The 500 errors are occurring specifically when attempting to filter support cases.
- All users are affected.
- The issue started within the past 30 minutes.
This supports the likelihood of a temporary backend or database processing issue with filtering functionality.

4. Additional Troubleshooting and Information
- Ensure your internet connection does not have intermittent drops or bandwidth issues, as this can impact connectivity to the cloud service.
- If possible, conduct a basic test by disabling any browser extensions that may modify loaded pages or requests.
For more troubleshooting steps, please refer to the article FogBugz On-Demand Slow, Non-Responsive, Unavailable, Offline, or Down [https://support.fogbugz.com/article/53690].

5. Interpreting Error Messages
The error message “There was a problem with your search string! 500 Internal Error” indicates a server-side processing issue with your filter parameters. If there are specific filters that trigger the error, try simplifying or adjusting parameters to identify if a certain field or value is the cause.

If the issue resolves itself after a brief period, it is likely related to a temporary backend processing issue. If it persists and none of the above steps help, monitor the status page [https://status.fogbugz.com] for related updates. For reference, all key diagnostic details and your screenshot confirm that the error is specific to filtering actions and not due to account inactivity or wiki configuration, as described in this article [https://support.fogbugz.com/article/53292].

If you have further technical details or additional screenshots that highlight new error messages or patterns, feel free to add them for further analysis.

Sincerely,
Atlas
FogBugz Support Team.

-------------------------

Thank you for contacting us regarding the intermittent internal server error 500 issues you and your team have been experiencing. We understand the urgency and apologize for any inconvenience this is causing.

To assist you as efficiently as possible, could you please provide the following information:
- The specific nature of the emergency, including how these errors are affecting your operations or users.
- Details about the current impact (e.g., are critical business functions disrupted?).
- Any particular error messages or codes, aside from “500 internal server error,” that have appeared.
- The best contact details should we need to follow up for more information or troubleshooting.

Your feedback will help us escalate and resolve the issue quickly. If you require additional time to gather these details, please note that your ticket will remain open for one additional week.

Sincerely,
